Name: iBMC Message Registry
Description: This registry defines the oem messages of iBMC for Redfish.

InvalidUserName.Description: Indicates that the user name is not valid.
InvalidUserName.Message: The user name is invalid because it is empty, starts with '#' '+' or '-', equals with "." or "..", or contains ":,\%&<>/"' ".
InvalidUserName.Resolution: Try again using a correct user name.

PropertyValueExceedsMaxLength.Description: Indicates that the value for the property exceeds the maximum length.
PropertyValueExceedsMaxLength.Message: The value %1 for the property %2 cannot exceed %3 characters.
PropertyValueExceedsMaxLength.Resolution: Try again using a correct value.

BodyExceedsMaxLength.Description: Indicates that the request body exceeds the maximum length.
BodyExceedsMaxLength.Message: The request body cannot exceed %1 characters.
BodyExceedsMaxLength.Resolution: Try again using a correct request body.

SetFusionPartitionFailed.Description: Indicates that the operation of switching the server between single-system mode and dual-system mode using FusionPar failed.
SetFusionPartitionFailed.Message: Failed to switch the server between single-system mode and dual-system mode using FusionPar because %1.
SetFusionPartitionFailed.Resolution: Ensure that the system A and system B have the same software version and CPLD version, the OSs are powered off, the authentication of the system B is successful, and the user has the administrator or operator rights.

InvalidPasswordLength.Description: Indicates that the password length is not valid.
InvalidPasswordLength.Message: A valid password must contain %1 to %2 characters.
InvalidPasswordLength.Resolution: Try again using a correct password.

InvalidPasswordSameWithHistory.Description: Indicates that the password is the same with history.
InvalidPasswordSameWithHistory.Message: A valid password cannot be limited history password.
InvalidPasswordSameWithHistory.Resolution: Try again using a correct password.

InvalidPassword.Description: Indicates that the password is not valid.
InvalidPassword.Message: The password cannot be empty or contain invalid ASCII characters.
InvalidPassword.Resolution: Try again using a correct password.

PasswordComplexityCheckFail.Description: Indicates that the password checks password complexity failed.
PasswordComplexityCheckFail.Message: Failed to send the request because the password does not meet password complexity requirements.
PasswordComplexityCheckFail.Resolution: Try again using a correct password.

DuringMinimumPasswordAge.Description: Indicates that the password is during the minimum password age.
DuringMinimumPasswordAge.Message: The password cannot be changed because it has not passed the minimum password age.
DuringMinimumPasswordAge.Resolution: Try again when the minimum password age ends.

UserIsLoggingIn.Description: Indicates that the property cannot be changed when user is logged in.
UserIsLoggingIn.Message: Failed to send the request because the associated user is logging in to the CLI.
UserIsLoggingIn.Resolution: Try again after the user logs out of the CLI.

EmergencyLoginUser.Description: Indicates that the modification requested for the property failed.
EmergencyLoginUser.Message: The property %1 cannot be modified because the user is an emergency login user.
EmergencyLoginUser.Resolution: Try again after setting the user to a non-emergency login user.

PasswordNotSatisfyComplexity.Description: Indicates that the modification requested for the property failed.
PasswordNotSatisfyComplexity.Message: The property %1 cannot be modified because the password does not meet password complexity requirements.
PasswordNotSatisfyComplexity.Resolution: Try again using a correct password.

LoginFailed.Description: Indicates that the login attempt was not successful.
LoginFailed.Message: Login failed because the user name or password is incorrect, or your account is locked.
LoginFailed.Resolution: Try again using the correct user name and password, or after your account is unlocked.

AuthorizationFailed.Description: Indicates that the authorization attempt was not successful.
AuthorizationFailed.Message: Authorization failed because the user name or password is incorrect, or your account is locked.
AuthorizationFailed.Resolution: Try again using the correct user name and password, or after your account is unlocked.

AuthorizationUserRestricted.Description: Indicates that the authorization attempt was not successful.
AuthorizationUserRestricted.Message: Authorization failed because it is restricted.
AuthorizationUserRestricted.Resolution: Try again as an unrestricted user.

AuthorizationUserNoAccess.Description: Indicates that the authorization attempt was not successful.
AuthorizationUserNoAccess.Message: Authorization failed because the user has no permission or is disabled, or the redfish interface is disabled.
AuthorizationUserNoAccess.Resolution: Try again using a user that has permission or is enabled.

AuthorizationUserPasswordExpired.Description: Indicates that the authorization attempt was not successful.
AuthorizationUserPasswordExpired.Message: Authorization failed because the password has expired.
AuthorizationUserPasswordExpired.Resolution: Try again using a valid user name and password.

AuthorizationUserLocked.Description: Indicates that the authorization attempt was not successful.
AuthorizationUserLocked.Message: Authorization failed because the user has been locked.
AuthorizationUserLocked.Resolution: Try again after unlocking the user.

NoAccess.Description: Indicates that the login attempt was not successful.
NoAccess.Message: Login failed because the user has no permission or is disabled, or the redfish interface is disabled.
NoAccess.Resolution: Try again using a user that has permission or is enabled.

UserLocked.Description: Indicates that the login attempt was not successful.
UserLocked.Message: Login failed because the user has been locked.
UserLocked.Resolution: Try again after unlocking the user.

UserPasswordExpired.Description: Indicates that the login attempt was not successful.
UserPasswordExpired.Message: Login failed because the password has expired.
UserPasswordExpired.Resolution: Try again using a valid user name and password.

UserLoginRestricted.Description: Indicates that the login attempt was not successful.
UserLoginRestricted.Message: Login failed because it is restricted.
UserLoginRestricted.Resolution: Try again as an unrestricted user.

PropertyModificationNeedPrivilege.Description: Indicates that the credentials associated with the established session do not have sufficient privileges for the requested modification.
PropertyModificationNeedPrivilege.Message: The property %1 cannot be modified because of insufficient permission.
PropertyModificationNeedPrivilege.Resolution: Try again as a user with sufficient permission.

AccountForbidRemoved.Description: Indicates that the account was not successful removed.
AccountForbidRemoved.Message: Emergency users and trap v3 users cannot be deleted.
AccountForbidRemoved.Resolution: Try again after setting the user to a non-emergency login user and non-trap-v3 user.

PropertyItemTypeError.Description: Indicates that an array item of a property was given the wrong items type, such as when a number is supplied for a property item that requires a string.
PropertyItemTypeError.Message: The type of the array item %1 for the property %2 is not supported by the property.
PropertyItemTypeError.Resolution: Modify the property value in the request body and try again.

PropertyItemDuplicate.Description: Indicates that a duplicate property item was included in the request body.
PropertyItemDuplicate.Message: The property item %1 was duplicated in the request.
PropertyItemDuplicate.Resolution: Remove the duplicate property item from the request body and try again.

PropertyItemNotInList.Description: Indicates that a property item was given the correct value type but the value of that property item was not supported. This values not in an enumeration.
PropertyItemNotInList.Message: The array item %1 for the property %2 is not in the list of acceptable values.
PropertyItemNotInList.Resolution: Try again using a value from the enumeration list.

PropertyItemMissing.Description: Indicates that a required property item was not supplied as part of the request.
PropertyItemMissing.Message: The property item %1 is required and must be included in the request.
PropertyItemMissing.Resolution: Ensure that the request body includes the property item and try again.

PropertyItemFormatError.Description: Indicates that an array item of property was given the correct value type but the value of that property item was not supported. This includes value size/length exceeded.
PropertyItemFormatError.Message: The format of the array item %1 for the property %2 is not supported by the property.
PropertyItemFormatError.Resolution: Correct the item for the property in the request body and try again.

ActionFailedByPowerOff.Description: Indicates that the action supplied with the POST operation failed because the device is powered off.
ActionFailedByPowerOff.Message: The action %1 failed because the device is powered off.
ActionFailedByPowerOff.Resolution: Ensure that the device is powered on and try again.

ActionFailedByBiosUpgrade.Description: Indicates that the action supplied with the POST operation failed because BIOS is being upgraded.
ActionFailedByBiosUpgrade.Message: The action %1 failed because BIOS is being upgraded.
ActionFailedByBiosUpgrade.Resolution: Try again after the BIOS upgrade is complete.

ActionFailedByVRDUpgrade.Description: Indicates that the action supplied with the POST operation failed because VRD is being upgraded.
ActionFailedByVRDUpgrade.Message: The action %1 failed because VRD is being upgraded.
ActionFailedByVRDUpgrade.Resolution: Try again after the VRD upgrade is complete.

UserNameIsRestricted.Description: Indicates that the property UserName cannot be changed to root when the user ID is not 2.
UserNameIsRestricted.Message: UserName cannot be root when the user ID is not 2.
UserNameIsRestricted.Resolution: Try again using a valid user name.

RoleIdIsRestricted.Description: Indicates that RoleId must be Administrator when the user ID is 2.
RoleIdIsRestricted.Message: RoleId must be Administrator when the user ID is 2.
RoleIdIsRestricted.Resolution: Try again using a valid RoleId.

InvalidHostName.Description: Indicates that the host name is invalid.
InvalidHostName.Message: The host name is invalid because it is empty, contains more than 64 characters, starts with '-', or contains the following characters:`~!@#$%^&*()_=+[{]}\|;:' ,<.>/?".
InvalidHostName.Resolution: Try again using a valid host name.

InvalidIPv4Address.Description: Indicates that the IPv4 address is invalid.
InvalidIPv4Address.Message: The value %1 for the property %2 is an invalid IPv4 address.
InvalidIPv4Address.Resolution: Try again using a valid IPv4 address.

InvalidIPv6Address.Description: Indicates that the IPv6 address is invalid.
InvalidIPv6Address.Message: The value %1 for the property %2 is an invalid IPv6 address.
InvalidIPv6Address.Resolution: Try again using a valid IPv6 address.

EmptyIPv6Address.Description: Indicates that the IPv6 address is empty.
EmptyIPv6Address.Message: The value of the property %1 is empty.
EmptyIPv6Address.Resolution: Try again using a valid IPv6 address.

InvalidSubnetMask.Description: Indicates that the IPv4 subnet mask is invalid.
InvalidSubnetMask.Message: The value %1 for the property %2 is invalid.
InvalidSubnetMask.Resolution: Try again using a valid IPv4 subnetmask.

LastTaskNotComplete.Description: The previous task has not completed.
LastTaskNotComplete.Message: The previous task has not completed.

ClearTableFail.Message: Failed to clear the table because %1.
ClearTableFail.Resolution: Check that the table is not in use.

ExportTableFail.Message: Failed to export the table because %1.
ExportTableFail.Resolution: Check that the table is not in use.

InvalidIPv4Gateway.Description: Indicates that the IPv4 gateway address is invalid.
InvalidIPv4Gateway.Message: The value %1 for the property %2 is an invalid IPv4 gateway address, or the IPv4 gateway address's network ID is different from the IPv4 address's network ID.
InvalidIPv4Gateway.Resolution: Try again using a valid IPv4 gateway address.

IPv4AddressConflict.Description: Indicates that the IPv4 address conflict with IPv4 gateway address or other group ip address.
IPv4AddressConflict.Message: The IPv4 address does not match the gateway address or conflicts with an IPv4 address in another group.
IPv4AddressConflict.Resolution: Ensure that the IPv4 address matches the gateway address and differs from all IPv4 addresses in other groups.

InvalidIPv6Gateway.Description: Indicates that the IPv6 gateway address is invalid.
InvalidIPv6Gateway.Message: The value %1 for the property %2 is an invalid IPv6 gateway address, or the IPv6 gateway address's network ID is different from the IPv6 address's network ID.
InvalidIPv6Gateway.Resolution: Try again using a valid IPv6 gateway address.

IPv6AddressConflictWithGateway.Description: Indicates that the IPv6 address conflict with the IPv6 gateway.
IPv6AddressConflictWithGateway.Message: The value %1 for the property %2 is the same as the property %3.
IPv6AddressConflictWithGateway.Resolution: Ensure that the IPv6 address and IPv6 gateway address are different and try again.

InvalidNameServer.Description: Indicates that the name server address is an invalid IPv4 address or IPv6 address.
InvalidNameServer.Message: The value %1 for the property %2 is an invalid IPv4 or IPv6 address.
InvalidNameServer.Resolution: Try again using a valid IPv4 or IPv6 address.

IPv4InfoConflictwithDHCP.Description: Indicates that the IPv4 information modification failed when the value of AddressOrigin is DHCP.
IPv4InfoConflictwithDHCP.Message: The request for IPv4Addresses modification failed because the value of IPv4Addresses/AddressOrigin is DHCP.
IPv4InfoConflictwithDHCP.Resolution: Ensure that the value of IPv4Addresses/AddressOrigin is Static and try again.

IPv6InfoConflictwithDHCPv6.Description: Indicates that the IPv6 information modification failed when the value of AddressOrigin is DHCPv6.
IPv6InfoConflictwithDHCPv6.Message: The request for IPv6Addresses modification failed because the value of IPv6Addresses/AddressOrigin is DHCPv6.
IPv6InfoConflictwithDHCPv6.Resolution: Ensure that the value of IPv6Addresses/AddressOrigin is Static and try again.

VLANInfoConflict.Description: Indicates that the VLAN information modification failed because VLANEnable is false.
VLANInfoConflict.Message: The request for VLAN modification failed because VLANEnable is false.
VLANInfoConflict.Resolution: Ensure that VLANEnable is true and try again.

IPv4SubnetMaskConflictWithDHCP.Description: Indicates that the IPv4 subnet mask modification failed when the address is in DHCP mode.
IPv4SubnetMaskConflictWithDHCP.Message: The request for the property %1 modification failed because the address is in DHCP mode.
IPv4SubnetMaskConflictWithDHCP.Resolution: Ensure that IPv4 address is in Static mode and try again.

IPv4GatewayConflictWithDHCP.Description: Indicates that the IPv4 gateway address modification failed when the address is in DHCP mode.
IPv4GatewayConflictWithDHCP.Message: The request for the property %1 modification failed because the address is in DHCP mode.
IPv4GatewayConflictWithDHCP.Resolution: Ensure that IPv4 address is in Static mode and try again.

IPv6PrefixConflictWithDHCPv6.Description: Indicates that the IPv6 prefix length modification failed when the address is in DHCPv6 mode.
IPv6PrefixConflictWithDHCPv6.Message: The request for the property %1 modification failed because the address is in DHCPv6 mode.
IPv6PrefixConflictWithDHCPv6.Resolution: Ensure that IPv6 address is in Static mode and try again.

IPv6GatewayConflictWithDHCPv6.Description: Indicates that the IPv6 gateway address modification failed when the address is in DHCPv6 mode.
IPv6GatewayConflictWithDHCPv6.Message: The request for the property %1 modification failed because the address is in DHCPv6 mode.
IPv6GatewayConflictWithDHCPv6.Resolution: Ensure that IPv6 address is in Static mode and try again.

PropertyModificationNotSupported.Message: The property %1 modification failed because it is not supported.
PropertyModificationNotSupported.Resolution: Remove the property from the request body and try again.

PortIdModificationFailed.Description: Indicates that the request to change the network protocol port ID failed because the new port ID value is not in the range of 1 to 65535 or already exists.
PortIdModificationFailed.Message: The value %1 for the property %2 is not in the range of 1 to 65535 or already exists.
PortIdModificationFailed.Resolution: Try again using a valid Port.

ResourceCannotBeCreated.Description: Indicates that a create operation was attempted on a resource that cannot be created.
ResourceCannotBeCreated.Message: The create request failed because the resource requested cannot be created.
ResourceCannotBeCreated.Resolution: Do not attempt to create a non-creatable resource.

TaskLimitExceeded.Description: Indicates that an asynchronous operation has been requested but the operation failed due to the number of simultaneous connection exceeding the limit of the implementation.
TaskLimitExceeded.Message: The asynchronous operation failed because the number of simultaneous tasks has reached the limit.
TaskLimitExceeded.Resolution: Try again when the tasks are complete.

FileTransferProtocolMismatch.Description: Indicates that the upgrade request failed because the transfer protocol specified in the image URI does not match that in the action parameter.
FileTransferProtocolMismatch.Message: The transfer protocols specified in the image URI and in the action parameter do not match.
FileTransferProtocolMismatch.Resolution: Check the transfer protocol in the request and try again.

FileTransferProgress.Description: Indicates that file transfer is in progress.
FileTransferProgress.Message: Downloading the upgrade package ... Progress: %1 complete.
FileTransferProgress.Resolution: Wait until the upgrade package is downloaded. The upgrade starts after the upgrade package is downloaded.

FirmwareUpgradeComponent.Description: Indicates that firmware upgrade is in progress.
FirmwareUpgradeComponent.Resolution: Wait until the upgrade is complete.

FirmwareUpgradeComplete.Description: Indicates that firmware upgrade is complete.

VolumeInitializing.Description: Indicates that volume initialize is in progress.
VolumeInitializing.Resolution: Wait until the Initialize is complete.

FirmwareUpgrading.Description: Indicates that a firmware upgrade task is in progress.
FirmwareUpgrading.Message: A file transfer task is being performed or an upgrade operation is in progress.
FirmwareUpgrading.Resolution: Wait until the upgrade is complete.

FirmwareUpgradeError.Description: An error occurred during the firmware upgrade process.
FirmwareUpgradeError.Message: An error occurred during the firmware upgrade process. Details: %1
FirmwareUpgradeError.Resolution: Locate the cause based on error information, rectify the fault, and submit the request again.

FileDownloadTaskOccupied.Description: Indicates that the firmware upgrade request failed due to other file is transfering.
FileDownloadTaskOccupied.Message: Other file is transfering, current upgrade request failed.
FileDownloadTaskOccupied.Resolution: Wait for a while, and submit the request again.

FileTransferErrorDesc.Description: Indicates that an error occurred during the file transfer process.
FileTransferErrorDesc.Message: An error occurred during the file transfer process. Details: %1.
FileTransferErrorDesc.Resolution: Rectify the fault and submit the request again.

CSRGeneratingErr.Description: Indicates that an error occurred during the CSR generation process.
CSRGeneratingErr.Resolution: Wait and submit the request again.

CSRGenFailed.Description: Indicates that an error occurred during the CSR generation process.
CSRGenFailed.Message: An error occurred during the CSR generation process.
CSRGenFailed.Resolution: Check the request and submit the request again.

CertImportOK.Description: Indicates that a certificate has been imported successfully.
CertImportOK.Message: The certificate has been imported successfully.
CertImportOK.Resolution: Restart the iBMC for the certificate to take effect.

CertImportOKNone.Description: Indicates that a certificate has been imported successfully.
CertImportOKNone.Message: The certificate has been imported successfully.

InvalidSyslogServerAddress.Description: Indicates that the syslog server address is invalid.
InvalidSyslogServerAddress.Message: The value %1 for the property %2 is invalid.
InvalidSyslogServerAddress.Resolution: Ensure that the address is a valid IPv4 address, IPv6 address or FQDN.

SyslogTestFailed.Description: Indicates that the syslog test failed.
SyslogTestFailed.Message: Syslog test failed because the syslog service or server is disabled or the server address is empty.
SyslogTestFailed.Resolution: Ensure that the syslog service and server are enabled and the server address is correct.

CertMismatch.Description: Indicates that an error occurred during the certificate import process.
CertMismatch.Message: Failed to import the certificate because the certificate verification failed.
CertMismatch.Resolution: Make sure that the certificate is valid.

CertImportFailed.Description: Indicates that an error occurred during the certificate import process.
CertImportFailed.Resolution: Make sure that the certificate content or URI is valid and the certificate is not oversized.

PemFormatErr.Description: Indicates that an error occurred during the process.
PemFormatErr.Message: Operation failed, because the certificate string is not in PEM format.
PemFormatErr.Resolution: Ensure that the certificate string is in PEM format.

ImportLimitExceed.Description: Indicates that an error occurred during the process.
ImportLimitExceed.Message: Operation failed, because the certificate or CRL to be imported has exceeded the limit of the implementation.
ImportLimitExceed.Resolution: Please reboot the OS to take effect.

BiosStateNotAllowed.Description: Indicates that an error occurred during the process.
BiosStateNotAllowed.Message: Operation failed, because BIOS state is not allowed.
BiosStateNotAllowed.Resolution: Check whether the BIOS is starting. If the BIOS is starting, try later.

CertificateExpired.Description: Indicates that an error occurred during the certificate import process.
CertificateExpired.Message: Failed to import the certificate because the certificate has expired.
CertificateExpired.Resolution: Ensure that the certificate to be imported is valid.

EncryptedCertImportFailed.Description: Indicates that an error occurred during the encrypted certificate importing process.
EncryptedCertImportFailed.Message: Failed to import the encrypted certificate.
EncryptedCertImportFailed.Resolution: Make sure that the certificate content or URI is valid, the certificate is not oversized, and the password is correct.

EncryptionAlgorithmIsWeak.Description: Indicates that an error occurred during the certificate import process.
EncryptionAlgorithmIsWeak.Message: Failed to import the certificate because the signature algorithm cannot be %1.
EncryptionAlgorithmIsWeak.Resolution: Make sure that the signature algorithm is not MD5/SHA1.

CertificateImportingErr.Description: Indicates that a certificate import task is in progress.
CertificateImportingErr.Message: A file transfer task is being performed or another certificate import operation is in progress.
CertificateImportingErr.Resolution: Wait until the certificate import operation is complete.

ProtocolNotAllowed.Description: Indicates the transfer protocol in the request is not allowed in current situation.
ProtocolNotAllowed.Message: Transfer protocol in the request body is not allowed to use in current situation.
ProtocolNotAllowed.Resolution: Try to use the protocol supported by the service.

CommandNotSupproted.Description: The device does not support the command from the POST.
CommandNotSupproted.Message: %2 of FRU%1 does not support the parameter %3.
CommandNotSupproted.Resolution: Check whether the device supports the command, and try again.

StorageControllerIDInvaid.Description: The operation failed because the StorageController ID entered is invalid.
StorageControllerIDInvaid.Message: The StorageController ID entered is invalid because the value %1 for the property %2 is incorrect.
StorageControllerIDInvaid.Resolution: Check the current StorageController ID and try again.

FruNotExist.Resolution: Check that the FRU exists, and try again.

PropertyModificationFailedByRAIDlevelNot.Description: Indicates that the operation failed because the current RAID level does not support the setting.
PropertyModificationFailedByRAIDlevelNot.Message: The current RAID level does not support the setting of property %1.
PropertyModificationFailedByRAIDlevelNot.Resolution: Check that the RAID level is greater than 0, and try again.

PropertyModificationNotSupportedByPDStat.Description: Indicates that the operation failed because the current physical disk status does not support the setting.
PropertyModificationNotSupportedByPDStat.Message: The current physical drive status does not support the setting of the property %1.
PropertyModificationNotSupportedByPDStat.Resolution: Check the current drive status, and check that the JBOD has been enabled for the RAID controller.

PropertyModificationNotSupportedByBBUSta.Description: Indicates that the operation failed because the BBU status does not support the setting.
PropertyModificationNotSupportedByBBUSta.Message: The current BBU status does not support the operation.
PropertyModificationNotSupportedByBBUSta.Resolution: Check whether the BBU is present and charged.

PropertyConflict.Description: Indicates that the request contains conflict properties.
PropertyConflict.Message: The properties %1 and %2 cannot be set at the same time.
PropertyConflict.Resolution: Determine the property to be set and try again.

ModifyfailedWithRaidControllerNotSupport.Description: Indicates that the modification of the volume property failed because the RAID controller does not support the modification.
ModifyfailedWithRaidControllerNotSupport.Message: Failed to modify volume property %1 because the RAID controller does not support modification of this property.
ModifyfailedWithRaidControllerNotSupport.Resolution: Do not modify the volume property.

ModifyfailedWithCachecade.Description: Indicates that the modification of the volume property failed because it is a cachecade volume.
ModifyfailedWithCachecade.Message: Failed to modify volume property %1 because it is a cachecade volume.
ModifyfailedWithCachecade.Resolution: Do not modify the volume property.

NoCachecadeVolume.Description: Indicates that the RAID controller has no cachecade volume.
NoCachecadeVolume.Message: Failed to modify volume property SSDCachingEnable because the RAID controller has no cachecade volume.

ModifyfailedWithSSD.Description: Indicates that the the modification of DriveCachePolicy failed because the volume consists of SSDs.
ModifyfailedWithSSD.Message: Failed to modify %1 because the volume consists of SSDs.
ModifyfailedWithSSD.Resolution: Do not modify the volume property.

StorageMediaInconsistent.Description: Indicates that the drive has different types of storage media, that is, the drive list contains both SSDs and HDDs.
StorageMediaInconsistent.Message: Failed to create the volume because the value %1 for the property %2 is set with different types of storage media.
StorageMediaInconsistent.Resolution: Try again using a valid value.

DriveInterfacesInconsistent.Description: Indicates that drive has different types of interfaces, that is, the drive list contains both SAS and SATA interfaces.
DriveInterfacesInconsistent.Message: Failed to create the volume because the value %1 for the property %2 is set with different types of interfaces.
DriveInterfacesInconsistent.Resolution: Try again using a valid value.

DifferentDriveSectorsSize.Description: Indicates that the drives selected have sectors of different sizes.
DifferentDriveSectorsSize.Message: Failed to create or modify the volume because the selected drives have sectors of different sizes.
DifferentDriveSectorsSize.Resolution: Use the drives with the same sector size.

DriveStatusNotSupported.Description: Indicates that current drive status does not support creation of the volume.
DriveStatusNotSupported.Message: Failed to create the volume because the current status specified by the value %1 for the property %2 does not support this operation.
DriveStatusNotSupported.Resolution: Try again using a valid value.

DriveListDuplicateValue.Description: Indicates that drive list contains duplicate value.
DriveListDuplicateValue.Message: Failed to create the volume because the value %1 for the property %2 is set with duplicate value.
DriveListDuplicateValue.Resolution: Try again using a valid value.

RAIDControllerNotSupportedOperation.Description: Indicates that the RAID controller does not support the operation.
RAIDControllerNotSupportedOperation.Message: The operation is failed because the value %1 for the property %2 does not support this operation.
RAIDControllerNotSupportedOperation.Resolution: Try again using a valid value.

ConfigurationExist.Description: Indicates that the requested operation cannot be performed.
ConfigurationExist.Message: Requested operation cannot be performed because there were volumes or enhanced physical drives.
ConfigurationExist.Resolution: Delete all volumes or enhanced physical drives and try again.

NumberOfSpansInvalid.Description: Indicates that the number of spans specified for creating the volume is invalid.
NumberOfSpansInvalid.Message: Failed to create the volume because the value %1 for the property %2 is invalid.
NumberOfSpansInvalid.Resolution: Try again using a valid value.

NumberofDrivesForEachSpanInvalid.Description: Indicates that the number of drives for each span is invalid.
NumberofDrivesForEachSpanInvalid.Message: Failed to create the volume because the number of drives for each span does not meet requirements. The value %1 for the property %2 is invalid.
NumberofDrivesForEachSpanInvalid.Resolution: Try again using a valid value.

RAIDReachedVolumesNumberLimit.Description: Indicates that the number of volumes managed by the current RAID controller has reached the limit.
RAIDReachedVolumesNumberLimit.Message: Failed to create the volume because the number of volumes managed by the RAID controller has reached the limit. The value %1 for the property %2 is invalid.
RAIDReachedVolumesNumberLimit.Resolution: Try again using a valid value.

ArraySpaceInsufficient.Description: Indicates that the array space for creating the volume is insufficient.
ArraySpaceInsufficient.Message: Failed to create the volume because of insufficient array space. The value %1 for the property %2 is invalid.
ArraySpaceInsufficient.Resolution: Add array space or reduce volumes.

ArraySpaceNoFree.Description: The array used to create the volume has no free space.
ArraySpaceNoFree.Message: Indicates that the array used to create the volume has no free space. The value %1 for the property %2 is invalid.
ArraySpaceNoFree.Resolution: Add array space or reduce volumes.

VolumeCapacityOutRange.Description: Indicates that volume capacity is out of range.
VolumeCapacityOutRange.Message: The operation is failed because the value for the property %1 is out of range.
VolumeCapacityOutRange.Resolution: Try again using a valid value.

AssociatedVolumeCapacityOutRange.Description: Indicates that the associated volume capacity is out of range.
AssociatedVolumeCapacityOutRange.Message: This operation is not supported because the associated volume capacity is out of range.
AssociatedVolumeCapacityOutRange.Resolution: Make sure that the associated volume capacity is within range.

StripeSizeOutRange.Description: Indicates that the stripe size is out of range.
StripeSizeOutRange.Message: Failed to create the volume because the value %1 for the property %2 is invalid.
StripeSizeOutRange.Resolution: Try again using a valid value.

CurrentStatusNotSupport.Description: Indicates that the current status does not support the operation.
CurrentStatusNotSupport.Message: Failed to create or delete the volume because the current status does not support it.

OperationNotSupported.Description: Indicates that the operation is not supported.
OperationNotSupported.Message: Failed to create or delete the volume because the operation is not supported.

NonSSDExist.Description: Indicates that the drive ID list contains non-SSD drives.
NonSSDExist.Message: The value %1 for the property %2 is invalid. CacheCade volumes must be created by SSD drives.
NonSSDExist.Resolution: Try again using a valid value.

PhysicalDiskIdCountError.Description: Indicates that the volume is not successfully created because the number of drive IDs set in the Drive ID List is incorrect.
PhysicalDiskIdCountError.Message: The value %1 for the property %2 is invalid because the number of drives specified is invalid.
PhysicalDiskIdCountError.Resolution: Try again using a valid value.

RaidControllerIdInvalid.Description: Indicates that the RAID controller ID is an invalid value.
RaidControllerIdInvalid.Message: The value %1 for the property %2 is invalid.
RaidControllerIdInvalid.Resolution: Try again using a valid RAID controller ID.

RAIDControllerNotSupported.Description: Indicates that the RAID controller does not support the modification.
RAIDControllerNotSupported.Message: The RAID controller does not support modification of the property %1.
RAIDControllerNotSupported.Resolution: Avoid modifying the RAID controller property.

StripeSizeError.Description: Indicates that the stripe size is incorrect.
StripeSizeError.Message: The value %1 for the property %2 is invalid. The stripe size can be 65536(64K), 131072(128K), 262144(256K), 524288(512K), or 1048576(1M).
StripeSizeError.Resolution: Try again using a valid value.

RackPowerCappingDisabled.Description: Indicates that the power capping function is disabled for the current cabinet, and rack peak clipping cannot be enabled
RackPowerCappingDisabled.Message: Failed to enable rack peak clipping because power capping is not enabled.

RackBatteryNotConfiguration.Description: Indicates that the cabinet is not configured with batteries and rack peak clipping cannot be enabled.
RackBatteryNotConfiguration.Message: Failed to enable rack peak clipping because the cabinet is not configured with batteries.
RackBatteryNotConfiguration.Resolution: Configure batteries for the cabinet first.

EnergySavingCfgNotAllowed.Description: Indicates that the configuration cannot be deployed because the last intelligent energy saving configuration is released with 10 minutes.
EnergySavingCfgNotAllowed.Message: Failed to deploy because the last intelligent energy saving configuration is released with 10 minutes.
EnergySavingCfgNotAllowed.Resolution: wait for a while,and submit the request again.

EnergySavingEnabledNotAllowed.Description: Indicates that the Intelligent energy saving cannot be enabled because the BMA is not running.
EnergySavingEnabledNotAllowed.Message: Failed to enable intelligent energy saving because the BMA is not running.
EnergySavingEnabledNotAllowed.Resolution: Ensure that the BMA is running.

EnergySavingPowerModeCfgNotAllowed.Description: Indicates that the power mode of the intelligent energy saving configuration cannot be set when N+R backup power is enabled.
EnergySavingPowerModeCfgNotAllowed.Message: Failed to set the power mode of the intelligent energy saving configuration when N+R backup is Enabled.
EnergySavingPowerModeCfgNotAllowed.Resolution: Ensure that the N+R power backup function is disabled.

ForbidSetPropertyByInbandChannel.Description: Indicates that it's not allowed to set this property by the request from inband channel.
ForbidSetPropertyByInbandChannel.Message: It's not allowed to modify property %1 by the request from inband channnel.
ForbidSetPropertyByInbandChannel.Resolution: Switch to outband channel and try again.

SpecifiedFileExist.Description: Indicates that there exists a file with the same name of the file to upload or generate.
SpecifiedFileExist.Message: It's not allowed to upload or generate file because there exists a file with the same file name in folder %1.
SpecifiedFileExist.Resolution: Change the file name of the file to upload or generate and try again.

NoPrivilegeToOperateSpecifiedFile.Description: Indicates that current user do not have the privilege to operate the specified file.
NoPrivilegeToOperateSpecifiedFile.Message: It's not allowed to operate the specified file because the file owner is different from current user.
NoPrivilegeToOperateSpecifiedFile.Resolution: Ensure that user to operate the specified file is the same with the file owner.

FailedSetNpuWhenPoweredOn.Description: Indicates that cannot set work mode of the NPU when the computing system is powered on.
FailedSetNpuWhenPoweredOn.Message: The work mode of NPU cannot be set when the computing system is powered on.
FailedSetNpuWhenPoweredOn.Resolution: Try again when the computing system is powered off.

ActionFailedByBbuExist.Description: Indicates that the action supplied with the POST operation failed because Bbu is installed.
ActionFailedByBbuExist.Message: The action %1 failed because Bbu is installed.
ActionFailedByBbuExist.Resolution: Try again after the Bbu is removed.

ServerIDModifyNotSupported.Description: If the syslog message format is RFC3164, Syslog Server Identity cannot be set and Host Name is used by default.
ServerIDModifyNotSupported.Message: If the syslog message format is RFC3164, Syslog Server Identity cannot be set and Host Name is used by default.
ServerIDModifyNotSupported.Resolution: Ensure that the syslog message format is Custom and try again.

CACertificateFormatError.Description: Failed to import the certificate because the certificate format is incorrect.
CACertificateFormatError.Message: Importing certificate fails because the certificate format is incorrect.
CACertificateFormatError.Resolution: Use a certificate in correct format.

CACertificateLackProperties.Description: Failed to import the certificate because the certificate lacks certain properties.
CACertificateLackProperties.Message: Failed to import the certificate because the certificate lacks certain properties.
CACertificateLackProperties.Resolution: Try again using a correct certificate.

AccountMustResetPassword.Description: After adding the IPMI, you must reset the password.
AccountMustResetPassword.Message: After adding the IPMI, you must reset the password.
AccountMustResetPassword.Resolution: Try again with a new account password.

ModifyAuthProtocolLackProp.Description: Account password and SNMP encryption password must be reset while changing SNMP authentication algorithm.
ModifyAuthProtocolLackProp.Message: Account password and SNMP encryption password must be reset while changing SNMP authentication algorithm.
ModifyAuthProtocolLackProp.Resolution: Try again with account password and SNMP encryption password.

PasswordNeedReset.Description: This password is an initial password or has been changed by another administrator. Please reset the password for security purposes.
PasswordNeedReset.Message: This password is an initial password or has been changed by another administrator. Please reset the password for security purposes.
PasswordNeedReset.Resolution: Reset the password and log in to the system.

ActionFailedByCpldUpgrade.Description: Indicates that the action supplied with the POST operation failed because CPLD is being upgraded.
ActionFailedByCpldUpgrade.Message: The action %1 failed because CPLD is being upgraded.
ActionFailedByCpldUpgrade.Resolution: Try again after the CPLD upgrade is complete.

PrivProtocolAes256NeedMatch.Description: encryption algorithm AES256 must macth with authentication algorithm SHA256/SHA384/SHA512.
PrivProtocolAes256NeedMatch.Message: The encryption algorithm AES256 must be used with the authentication algorithm SHA256, SHA384, or SHA512.
PrivProtocolAes256NeedMatch.Resolution: Change the authentication algorithm into SHA256/SHA384/SHA512.

RootCANotExists.Description: The root certificate you want to delete does not exist.
RootCANotExists.Message: The root certificate you want to delete does not exist.

RootCAAlreadyExists.Message: Importing root certificate fails because the certificate already exists.
RootCAAlreadyExists.Resolution: Do not import the same certificate repeatedly.

RootCAQuantityExceedLimit.Description: Failed to import the root certificate because the number of certificates has reached the upper limit.
RootCAQuantityExceedLimit.Message: Failed to import the root certificate because the number of certificates has reached the upper limit.
RootCAQuantityExceedLimit.Resolution: Try again after deleting a existing certificate.

RAIDControllerSetSuccessfully.Description: Set RAID controller successfully, please reboot the OS to take effect.
RAIDControllerSetSuccessfully.Message: Set RAID controller successfully, please reboot the OS to take effect.

VolumeSetSuccessfully.Description: Set Volume successfully, please reboot the OS to take effect.
VolumeSetSuccessfully.Message: Set Volume successfully, please reboot the OS to take effect.

SwitchBoardSetFailed.Description: Set switch board network configuration failed, because the board response error.
SwitchBoardSetFailed.Message: Set switch board network configuration failed, because the board response error.

TLSVersionConfigurationNotSupported.Description: Failed to configure TLS version because it is not supported.
TLSVersionConfigurationNotSupported.Message: Only two options are supported: TLS 1.2 and later versions, and TLS 1.3.
TLSVersionConfigurationNotSupported.Resolution: The TLS version must be configured correctly.

NotAllowedToOverwriteDirectory.Description: Indicates that there exists a system directory with the same name of the file to upload or generate.
NotAllowedToOverwriteDirectory.Message: It's not allowed to upload or generate file because it will overwrite a system directory.
NotAllowedToOverwriteDirectory.Resolution: Change the file name of the file to upload or generate and try again.

UserLdapAuthFail.Description: Possible causes of an LDAP authentication failure include wrong password, TLS version earlier than 1.2, incorrect LDAP certificate, or expired LDAP certificate.
UserLdapAuthFail.Message: Possible causes of an LDAP authentication failure include wrong password, TLS version earlier than 1.2, incorrect LDAP certificate, or expired LDAP certificate.
UserLdapAuthFail.Resolution: Check the cause of LDAP authentication failure according to the prompt.

TLSFailedWithTwoFactorCertification.Description: Failed to configure TLS version because two-factor authentication is enabled.
TLSFailedWithTwoFactorCertification.Message: Failed to configure TLS version because two-factor authentication is enabled.
TLSFailedWithTwoFactorCertification.Resolution: Disable two-factor authentication and try again.

TwoFactorCertificationFailedWithTLS.Description: Failed to enable two-factor authentication because TLS version not supported.
TwoFactorCertificationFailedWithTLS.Message: Failed to enable two-factor authentication because TLS version not supported.
TwoFactorCertificationFailedWithTLS.Resolution: Set the TLS version to TLS 1.2 or later and try again.

UnEnableNetworkPort.Description: The current network port is disabled.
UnEnableNetworkPort.Message: The current network port is disabled.
UnEnableNetworkPort.Resolution: Modify parameters on an enabled network port.

CertificateNotMatchDevice.Description: Failed to import the certificate because the certificate does not match the device.
CertificateNotMatchDevice.Message: Failed to import the certificate because the certificate does not match the device.
CertificateNotMatchDevice.Resolution: Use a certificate that matches the device.

CANotSupportCrlSignature.Description: Failed to import the CRL because the root certificate does not support CRL signature.
CANotSupportCrlSignature.Message: Failed to import the CRL because the root certificate does not support CRL signature.
CANotSupportCrlSignature.Resolution: Import a CA certificate that supports CRL signature.

IncompleteForeignConfig.Description: Indicates that the requested operation cannot be performed.
IncompleteForeignConfig.Message: Requested operation cannot be performed because of incomplete foreign configuration.

NoForeignConfig.Description: Indicates that the requested operation cannot be performed.
NoForeignConfig.Message: Requested operation cannot be performed because the RAID controller has no foreign configuration.

ConfigPortLLDPErr.Description: The configuration of LLDP for the port fails.
ConfigPortLLDPErr.Message: Failed to configure LLDP for the port.
ConfigPortLLDPErr.Resolution: Check the MCTP links and NIC firmware version, and try again.

PCIePortEnabledErr.Description: The LLDP configuration of the port fails because the PCIe port is disabled.
PCIePortEnabledErr.Message: Failed to configure LLDP for the port because the PCIe port is disabled.
PCIePortEnabledErr.Resolution: Enable the PCIe port and try again.

BMCNotSupportediBMA.Description: The current state does not support this operation.
BMCNotSupportediBMA.Message: This operation is not supported because the BMC does not support iBMA.

IBMADeleteParameterError.Description: Indicates that the parameter supplied for the action is not supported on the resource.
IBMADeleteParameterError.Message: The parameter %1 for the operation of delete iBMA is not supported.
IBMADeleteParameterError.Resolution: Delete this parameter and try again.

BMCPlatformNotMatchiBMA.Description: The iBMA platform does not match to BMC.
BMCPlatformNotMatchiBMA.Message: This operation is not supported because the iBMA platform does not match to BMC.
BMCPlatformNotMatchiBMA.Resolution: Please confirm iBMA upgrade packge platform is right and try agin.

IBMAUpgradePackageInvalid.Description: The iBMA upgrade package is invalid.
IBMAUpgradePackageInvalid.Message: The iBMA upgrade package is invalid.

IBMAUpgradeURIIllegal.Description: Indicates that the iBMA upgrade file path is incorrect.
IBMAUpgradeURIIllegal.Message: The iBMA upgrade file path is incorrect.

IBMAUpgradeFileCheckErr.Description: Indicates that the iBMA upgrade file check fail.
IBMAUpgradeFileCheckErr.Message: The iBMA upgrade file check fail.

IBMAUpgradeProgress.Description: Indicates that upgrade is in progress.

ModifyFailedMissingReqProperties.Description: Indicates that the modify operation failed because the required property was missing from the request.
ModifyFailedMissingReqProperties.Message: Modify %1 failed because %2 was missing from the request.
ModifyFailedMissingReqProperties.Resolution: Correct the body to include the required property with a valid value and resubmit the request if the operation failed.

CrlNotExisted.Message: The CRL file does not exist.

SetNMIFailed.Description: Set non-maskable interrupt (NMI) to the PCIe device failed.
SetNMIFailed.Message: the PCIe device may not supports NMI.
SetNMIFailed.Resolution: Make sure that the PCIe device supports NMI.

SubmitResumedEventCompletely.Description: Indicates that submit of resumed events is complete.
SubmitResumedEventCompletely.Message: Submit these events is complete, success: %1, fail: %2.

SubmittingResumedEvent.Description: Indicates that event to be resumed is being submitted.
SubmittingResumedEvent.Message: Resuming the subscription whose id is %1, success: %2, fail: %3
SubmittingResumedEvent.Resolution: Wait until the events are submitted completely.

SumittingResumedErr.Description: Indicates that a resume task is in progress.
SumittingResumedErr.Message: A resumed task is being performed in progress.
SumittingResumedErr.Resolution: Wait until the resumed task operation is complete.
